result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric A Godinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 30 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 4, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer through the inter-state compact to the State of Texas if they will accept the transfer.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  
Buy Money of $2,000 is ordered payable to Metro Drug Unit and to be paid within the first 24 months of Probation.  Extradition Costs of $2,254.56 is ordered payable to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office and to be paid within the first 12 months of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Eric A Godinez in court with attorney Peter M Wolff. 

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's Mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 3:
Total Prison:  7 Years.
Initial Confinement:  4 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
30 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
Concurrent to count 4.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  3.5 Years.
Court will allow for transfer through the inter-state complact to the State of Texas if they are willing to accept him.
CONDITIONS PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Buy Money:  $2,000   )to be paid to METRO DRUG) to be paid in full within the first 24 months of probation.
RESTITUTION:  $2,254.56 (to be paid to the Waukesha County District Attorney's Office for Extradition Costs - to be paid before costs/fines/surcharges) - to be paid within first 12 months.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  




Count 4:
Total Prison:  3.5  Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5  Years.
Extended Supervision:  2  Years.
Concurrent to count 3.
30 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3.5 Years.
Court will allow for transfer through the inter-state complact to the State of Texas if they are willing to accept him.
CONDITIONS of Probation:
Same as count 3.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Court will allow for the defendant to return to the State of Texas pending the approval of the inter - State Compact.

Attorney Wolff requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
